https://blogs.library.columbia.edu/journalism 88 3

Image elements do not have <code>[alt]</code> attributes

Informative elements should aim for short, descriptive alternate text. Decorative elements can be ignored with an empty alt attribute. Learn more about the <code>alt</code> attribute.

Examples:

    Links rely on color to be distinguishable.

    Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. Link text that is discernible improves the experience for users with low vision. Learn how to make links distinguishable.

    Examples:

      Links do not have a discernible name

      Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. Learn how to make links accessible.

                                https://amesa.library.columbia.edu/ 80 6

                                Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.

                                Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. Learn more.

                                Examples:

                                • ... and 7 more

                                <code><html></code> element does not have a <code>[lang]</code> attribute

                                If a page doesn't specify a lang attribute, a screen reader assumes that the page is in the default language that the user chose when setting up the screen reader. If the page isn't actually in the default language, then the screen reader might not announce the page's text correctly. Learn more.

                                Examples:

                                  Image elements do not have <code>[alt]</code> attributes

                                  Informative elements should aim for short, descriptive alternate text. Decorative elements can be ignored with an empty alt attribute. Learn more.

                                  Examples:

                                    Links do not have a discernible name

                                    Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. Learn more.

                                    Examples:

                                      Lists do not contain only <code><li></code> elements and script supporting elements (<code><script></code> and <code><template></code>).

                                      Screen readers have a specific way of announcing lists. Ensuring proper list structure aids screen reader output. Learn more.

                                      Examples:

                                        List items (<code><li></code>) are not contained within <code><ul></code> or <code><ol></code> parent elements.

                                        Screen readers require list items (<code><li></code>) to be contained within a parent <code><ul></code> or <code><ol></code> to be announced properly. Learn more.

                                        Examples:
                                          https://findingaids.library.columbia.edu/ 89 3

                                          Elements with an ARIA <code>[role]</code> that require children to contain a specific <code>[role]</code> are missing some or all of those required children.

                                          Some ARIA parent roles must contain specific child roles to perform their intended accessibility functions. Learn more.

                                          Examples:

                                            Background and foreground colors do not have a sufficient contrast ratio.

                                            Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. Learn more.

Learn more.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Examples:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Links do not have a discernible name

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. Learn more.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                https://onomatopoeia.podcasts.library.columbia.edu/podcast/losing-myself-in-the-park/ 95 2

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Examples:

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Links do not have a discernible name

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users. Learn more.
